publication_name.ja: 日本機械学会論文集Ｃ編

paper_title.en: Study on Finishing of Pinion Cutters by Form Grinding (2nd Report, Finishing of Tooth Flanks by Multiple Motions)

description.en: This report describes a new method to finish tooth flanks of pinion cutters by form grinding with multiple relieving motions, which are the approaching motion between the grinding wheel and the pinion cutter, the rotational motion of the pinion cutter and the shifting motion of the grinding wheel. The method can successfully finish the whole depth of the cutting edge of the pinion cutter with an arbitrary profile by one-pass grinding for each tooth flank. The motions were decided as to minimize the cutting edge errors at two regrinding positions. As an example of profile calculation and the finishing test, the involute helical pinion cutter with a protuberance was selected. The profile of grinding wheel was calculated by applying the element removal method. The finishing test was conducted on the NC form gear-grinding machine and the pinion cutter with almost no profile error and a small regrinding error was obtained. © 2001, The Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Effects of Tooth Profile and Addendum Modification on Efficiency of Cylindrical Worm Gears

publication_name.en: Proceedings of ASME 8th Power Transmission and Gearing Conference

paper_title.en: Sharpening of Hob Cutting Edges with Helical Flutes

description.en: Sharpening of a hob with helical flutes is a difficult problem in the gear production field because interference between a grinding wheel and hob rake face is apt to occur. In this paper, mechanism of interference in hob sharpening is analyzed and the condition without interference that causes a trouble is shown by means of the figure. Then, the profile of grinding wheel for sharpening the hob with helical flutes is calculated using the element removal method in the same way as form grinding of the helical gear with a profile of straight line. Also, the relation between the depth of hob flute and the tooth height of hob rake face being finished is shown by means of the figure. The sharpening test of the involute worm hob (mn = 5, N=3, γ =23.917°) was conducted using the CNC gear form grinding machine. The radial alignment of hob rake face after sharpening was less than 5 μm. © 2000, The Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Nihon Kikai Gakkai Ronbunshu, C Hen/Transactions of the Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers, Part C

paper_title.en: Study on Finishing of Pinion Cutters by Form Grinding (1st Report, Finishing of Tooth Flanks by Excessive Helical Motions)

description.en: A new form relief grinding method for an involute pinion cutter with almost no regrinding error is proposed. In the method, the tooth flanks of pinion cutter are finished as those of involute helical gears with excessive (larger and smaller) helix angles than that of the pinion cutter. The obtained results are as follows: (1) In the conventional generating method, it is impossible to finish an involute pinion cutter with no profile error. (2) The profiles of grinding wheel to finish a pinion cutter under excessive helical motions are calculated. (3) Profile errors of a pinion cutter being finished by the proposed method are smaller than those finished by the conventional method. (4) The finishing test of pinion cutter (mn = 2.5 mm, N = 39, β = 15°) was conducted on the NC form grinding machine and the pinion cutter with the accurate cutting edges was obtained. © 2000, The Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Nihon Kikai Gakkai Ronbunshu, C Hen/Transactions of the Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers, Part C

paper_title.ja: ウォーム歯車の歯面修整に関する研究(第4報,転位を行う場合の取扱い)
paper_title.en: Studies on Tooth Surface Modification of Worm Gears (4th Report, For Worm Gears with Addendum Modification)

description.ja: A new technique to obtain optimum tooth surface modification (crowning) for worm gears with addendum modification is proposed. This technique that is called no-addendum-modification treatment (NAMT) can realize worm gears that produce accurate engagement with no transmission error and no interference even if the addendum modification is very large. The technique is applied to the worm gears with a convex worm and a negative addendum modification and those with a concave worm and a positive addendum modification. Consequently, it is shown by using contour line diagrams that ideal modified tooth surfaces with no transmission error and no interference are obtained.
description.en: A new technique to obtain optimum tooth surface modification (crowning) for worm gears with addendum modification is proposed. This technique that is called no-addendum-modification treatment (NAMT) can realize worm gears that produce accurate engagement with no transmission error and no interference even if the addendum modification is very large. The technique is applied to the worm gears with a convex worm and a negative addendum modification and those with a concave worm and a positive addendum modification. Consequently, it is shown by using contour line diagrams that ideal modified tooth surfaces with no transmission error and no interference are obtained.

paper_title.ja: ウォーム歯車の歯面修整に関する研究(第3報,条数が多い場合の取扱い)
paper_title.en: Studies on Tooth Surface Modification of Worm Gears (3rd Report, for Worm Gears with a Large Number of Worm Threads)

description.ja: In worm gears, it is very important to modify the wheel tooth surface to give an entrance gap between the worm and worm-wheel surfaces. A new modification method that can be applied to worm gears with an arbitrary profile was proposed in our previous report. However, it was found that interference occurs between the worm and wheel surfaces when the method is applied to worm gears with a large number of worm threads. In this report, two techniques are introduced to prevent the interference and to obtain good entrance and exit gaps. One is to compensate for the tilting angle of a hob axis in the cutting wheel and the other is to use a hob with a larger thread number than that of the worm. The meshing clearance which indicate the meshing characteristics of worm gears are calculated and shown by means of contour line diagrams by changing the tilting angie of the hob axis and the number of hob threads. As a result, it was found that these techniques are very useful for worm gears with a large number of worm threads.
description.en: In worm gears, it is very important to modify the wheel tooth surface to give an entrance gap between the worm and worm-wheel surfaces. A new modification method that can be applied to worm gears with an arbitrary profile was proposed in our previous report. However, it was found that interference occurs between the worm and wheel surfaces when the method is applied to worm gears with a large number of worm threads. In this report, two techniques are introduced to prevent the interference and to obtain good entrance and exit gaps. One is to compensate for the tilting angle of a hob axis in the cutting wheel and the other is to use a hob with a larger thread number than that of the worm. The meshing clearance which indicate the meshing characteristics of worm gears are calculated and shown by means of contour line diagrams by changing the tilting angie of the hob axis and the number of hob threads. As a result, it was found that these techniques are very useful for worm gears with a large number of worm threads.

paper_title.ja: ペンシル形砥石によるウォームホブの二番取り研削
paper_title.en: Relief Grinding of Worm Hobs with a Pencil Wheel

description.ja: A new method for calculating the profile of a pencil-type grinding wheel to finish worm hobs is proposed using the element removal method. The method realizes the finishing of worm hobs with an arbitrary profile and a large lead angle, without depending on the experience and perception of an expert. In this paper, a worm hob (m_n=5 mm, N_h=3, rh=18.5 mm) is used as an example of profile calculation and finishing tests. The regrinding errors of the cutting edge profiles of the hobs to be finished with the pencil wheel and disk wheel are discussed by calculating the changes in the rack profiles expressed by the hob cutting edges after regrinding. To show the usefulness of the proposed method, the finishing tests of the worm hob were conducted on the CNC relief grinding machine with the pencil wheel attachment made by the authors. The accuracy of the finished worm hob was in the zero class of JIS.
description.en: A new method for calculating the profile of a pencil-type grinding wheel to finish worm hobs is proposed using the element removal method. The method realizes the finishing of worm hobs with an arbitrary profile and a large lead angle, without depending on the experience and perception of an expert. In this paper, a worm hob (m_n=5 mm, N_h=3, rh=18.5 mm) is used as an example of profile calculation and finishing tests. The regrinding errors of the cutting edge profiles of the hobs to be finished with the pencil wheel and disk wheel are discussed by calculating the changes in the rack profiles expressed by the hob cutting edges after regrinding. To show the usefulness of the proposed method, the finishing tests of the worm hob were conducted on the CNC relief grinding machine with the pencil wheel attachment made by the authors. The accuracy of the finished worm hob was in the zero class of JIS.

description.ja: A new method for calculating the profile of a pencil-type grinding wheel to finish worm hobs is proposed using the element removal method. The method realizes the finishing of worm hobs with an arbitrary profile and a large lead angle, without depending on the experience and perception of an expert. In this paper, a worm hob (m_n=5 mm, N_h=3, rh=18.5 mm) is used as an example of profile calculation and finishing tests. The regrinding errors of the cutting edge profiles of the hobs to be finished with the pencil wheel and disk wheel are discussed by calculating the changes in the rack profiles expressed by the hob cutting edges after regrinding. To show the usefulness of the proposed method, the finishing tests of the worm hob were conducted on the CNC relief grinding machine with the pencil wheel attachment made by the authors. description.en: A new method for calculating the profile of a pencil-type grinding wheel to finish worm hobs is proposed using the element removal method. The method realizes the finishing of worm hobs with an arbitrary profile and a large lead angle, without depending on the experience and perception of an expert. In this paper, a worm hob (m_n=5 mm, N_h=3, rh=18.5 mm) is used as an example of profile calculation and finishing tests. To show the usefulness of the proposed method, the finishing tests of the worm hob were conducted on the CNC relief grinding machine with the pencil wheel attachment made by the authors. The accuracy of the finished worm hob was in the zero class of JIS.

paper_title.ja: ウォーム歯車の歯面修整に関する研究(第2報,歯面修整ウォーム歯車の歯当たり試験)
paper_title.en: Studies on Tooth Surface Modiflcation of Worm Gears (2nd Report, Tooth Bearing Tests of Worm Gears with Modified Tooth Surface)

description.ja: The purpose of this study is to prove the usefulness of the surface modification method for cylindrical worm gears as proposed in the first report. The method is applicable to worm gears with an arbitrary profile, producing a good entrance gap without transmission error. The entrance gap is indispensable for worm gear drives. This paper is composed of three parts. First, a method for calculating the grinding wheel profile in order to finish a worm with an arbitrary profile is proposed. Second, the grinding tests of the involute worm gears with from 1 to 7 threads are conducted using the CNC gear grinder. Third, the proposed modification method is applied to the worm gears (m=4 mm, N_1/N_2=3/38) when the cutting edge profile of the hob for finishing the worm wheel was given. A pair of test worm gears is fabricated and the tooth bearing tests are conducted. The tooth bearing patterns with a good entrance gap were obtained as expected in the design stage.
description.en: The purpose of this study is to prove the usefulness of the surface modification method for cylindrical worm gears as proposed in the first report. The method is applicable to worm gears with an arbitrary profile, producing a good entrance gap without transmission error. The entrance gap is indispensable for worm gear drives. This paper is composed of three parts. First, a method for calculating the grinding wheel profile in order to finish a worm with an arbitrary profile is proposed. Second, the grinding tests of the involute worm gears with from 1 to 7 threads are conducted using the CNC gear grinder. Third, the proposed modification method is applied to the worm gears (m=4 mm, N_1/N_2=3/38) when the cutting edge profile of the hob for finishing the worm wheel was given. A pair of test worm gears is fabricated and the tooth bearing tests are conducted. The tooth bearing patterns with a good entrance gap were obtained as expected in the design stage.

paper_title.ja: ウォーム歯車の歯面修整に関する研究(第1報,歯面修整の新しい考え方)
paper_title.en: Studies on Tooth-Surface Modification of Worm Gears (1st Report, A New Method of Worm-Wheel Crowning)

description.ja: A new crowning method that can be applied to worm gears with an arbitrary profile and causes no transmission error is proposed. The main points of this crowning method are as follows: (1) the profile of a hob is related to that of a worm via a rack profile, (2) a pitch circle diameter of the hob is made larger than that of the worm, (3) the worm-wheel is hobbed by the hob of which axis is tilted as in the case of hobbing helical gears. It is shown by using contour-line diagrams of the contact and meshing clearances between the teeth of the worm and mating worm-wheel that the crowning method proposed in this investigation brings about a desirable tooth surface modification, i. e. , large entrance gap and small exit gap.
description.en: A new crowning method that can be applied to worm gears with an arbitrary profile and causes no transmission error is proposed. The main points of this crowning method are as follows: (1) the profile of a hob is related to that of a worm via a rack profile, (2) a pitch circle diameter of the hob is made larger than that of the worm, (3) the worm-wheel is hobbed by the hob of which axis is tilted as in the case of hobbing helical gears. It is shown by using contour-line diagrams of the contact and meshing clearances between the teeth of the worm and mating worm-wheel that the crowning method proposed in this investigation brings about a desirable tooth surface modification, i. e. , large entrance gap and small exit gap.

paper_title.ja: 歯車のかみあい状態の可視化に関する研究(円筒ウォームの場合)
paper_title.en: Computerized Visualization of Contact and Meshing of Gears (For Cylindrical Worm Gears)

description.ja: A computerized method of visualizing contact and meshing of gears using contour lines is proposed. The tooth surfaces of driving and driven gears are calculated as series of two-dimensional tooth profiles on each transverse/axial plane using the element removal method that simulates the metal removal process in gear finishing, and are transformed to 3-D data in a lattice structure to draw a contour-line diagram. The contour-line diagram of contact clearance is obtained by comparing a pair of tooth surfaces, and that of meshing clearance is obtained by comparing the tooth surface conjugate to the driving gear with that of the driven gear. The diagrams of the contact and meshing clearances are used to estimate the contact stress and to evaluate the transmission error of the gears, respectively. The proposed method was applied to cylindrical worm gears with a large lead angle, and it was found that the method is very useful in the design of worm gears.
description.en: A computerized method of visualizing contact and meshing of gears using contour lines is proposed. The tooth surfaces of driving and driven gears are calculated as series of two-dimensional tooth profiles on each transverse/axial plane using the element removal method that simulates the metal removal process in gear finishing, and are transformed to 3-D data in a lattice structure to draw a contour-line diagram. The contour-line diagram of contact clearance is obtained by comparing a pair of tooth surfaces, and that of meshing clearance is obtained by comparing the tooth surface conjugate to the driving gear with that of the driven gear. The diagrams of the contact and meshing clearances are used to estimate the contact stress and to evaluate the transmission error of the gears, respectively. The proposed method was applied to cylindrical worm gears with a large lead angle, and it was found that the method is very useful in the design of worm gears.

paper_title.ja: はすば歯車の三次元的歯面修整に関する研究( 歯車軸の曲げによる軸角と歯当たりの変化)
paper_title.en: Studies on 3-D Tooth-Surface Modification of Helical Gears (Changes in Shaft Angle and Tooth-Bearing Pattern Caused by Bending Deformation of Gear Shafts)

description.ja: It is becoming important to modify three-dimensionally the tooth surfaces of gears in consideration of the machining and mounting errors of the gears in the manufacturing process, and of the elastic and thermal deformations of the gear teeth, gear shafts and gear casing during gear running. In this paper, the meshing characteristics of the gears with the shaft angle errors caused by bending of the gear shafts are analyzed. Firstly, two kinds of shaft angle errors are calculated when the structure and loading conditions of the gear set are given. Secondly, the transmission error and tooth bearing pattern of the gears with the shaft angle errors are calculated, which are used to evaluate whether or not the tooth surface modification is appropriate. To confirm the usefulness of this calculation method, tooth bearing tests using ground gears with modified tooth surfaces were conducted. The experimental results agreed with the calculated ones for the most part.
description.en: It is becoming important to modify three-dimensionally the tooth surfaces of gears in consideration of the machining and mounting errors of the gears in the manufacturing process, and of the elastic and thermal deformations of the gear teeth, gear shafts and gear casing during gear running. In this paper, the meshing characteristics of the gears with the shaft angle errors caused by bending of the gear shafts are analyzed. Firstly, two kinds of shaft angle errors are calculated when the structure and loading conditions of the gear set are given. Secondly, the transmission error and tooth bearing pattern of the gears with the shaft angle errors are calculated, which are used to evaluate whether or not the tooth surface modification is appropriate. To confirm the usefulness of this calculation method, tooth bearing tests using ground gears with modified tooth surfaces were conducted. The experimental results agreed with the calculated ones for the most part.
